content.Allocation of Profits:
The profits and losses of the partnership firm, commencing on the day of the agreement, shall be divided and allocated to the partners on an equal basis, each partner therefore sharing equally in the profits and losses of the partnership firm. Despite any clause to the contrary, the aforementioned allocation of profits and losses to partners shall be proportionate to their contributions to OLA.

Each partner shall receive a distribution of OLA's profits annually. Such allocation shall be made in a way that fairly represents each partner's rights to share in the profits. In no event shall a partner receive a share of the profits that is less than the profit share that such partner would have received if the profits were allocated in the proportion that the partner's contribution to OLA bears to the total contributions of all partners.

For the purpose of allocating profits and losses among the partners and for the purpose the distribution of profits, the partnership firm's 'profit' shall mean the net profit of the partnership firm as calculated in accordance with the Indian partnership Act 1932 and 'loss' shall mean the net loss of the partnership firm as calculated in accordance with the Indian partnership Act 1932.

Further, any tax implications, arising as a result of the distribution of the profits, shall be borne by the respective partners based on their share in the profits.

This arrangement is initiated for a citation of 24 months. The agreed sum stands confirmed as 1004217.082 INR.

This deed is executed in good faith and trust between the parties and each party to this Deed declares that, it has full power, right and authority to enter into this partnership. It is mutually understood that the terms and conditions set out in this section are fair, reasonable and reciprocal.
content.Dispute Resolution:
In the event of any dispute, difference, or question, arising from or in relation to the terms and conditions of the present Partnership Agreement, the matter shall be put forth for resolution to a mutually nominated sole arbitrator. The manner and process of arbitration shall be conducted in accordance with the provisions of the Arbitration and Conciliation Act 1996 and any amendments enacted thereto.

The language of the arbitration proceedings shall be English and the venue of arbitration shall be in any city in India as mutually agreed upon by the parties. The arbitral award shall be final and binding upon the parties.

In relation to the above, either party may apply to a court of competent jurisdiction for interim or conservatory relief and the court's decision would not be regarded as an infringement or waiver of the arbitration agreement and the making of such a request, will not be deemed the commencement of legal proceedings.

The costs of arbitration including the fees of the arbitrator will be borne by the parties as determined by the arbitrator. The arbitrator may award to the party who substantially prevails in the arbitration, the costs of arbitration and the reasonable attorney's fees incurred by such party.

In the instance of the award requiring enforcement, the parties hereby agree to subject themselves to the jurisdiction of the courts in the city determined as the venue of arbitration and further agree that execution may issue upon any judgment awarded in such arbitration proceedings.

The Parties agree and declare that notwithstanding, the existence of any dispute or difference or the initiation of any legal or arbitration proceedings each shall continue to perform their respective obligations under the agreement unless the agreement is terminated in accordance with the established terms and conditions.
content.Dissolution and Exit Strategy:
The partners agree that upon the occurrence of any of the following events, the partnership may be dissolved: a unanimous written agreement of the partners to dissolve; the death or incapacity of any partner; the bankruptcy or insolvency of any partner; or the expiry of the term of the partnership.

In the event of dissolution, the assets of the partnership shall first be used to pay partnership liabilities, and then to return the capital contributions of the partners. Any remaining assets shall be distributed among the partners according to their respective profit sharing ratios.

If the partnership proves to be unprofitable, the partners may agree to terminate it prior to the end of its term. Any outstanding liabilities or obligations will be resolved according to the terms of this Agreement and applicable statutory provisions.

The exiting partner or his/her legal representative will be entitled to receive his/her share of the partnership assets, after the partnership debts and obligations have been settled. The continuing partners may also opt to purchase the exiting partner’s share at a mutually agreed price.

In the event the partnership is dissolved but the business is continued by the remaining partners, the departing partner or his/her legal representative shall have no further claim or right of any nature whatsoever to the partnership business or any asset of the partnership, and they will execute a release confirmation of this fact in writing.

Given the complexity of laws regarding partnership dissolution, it is advisable to seek expert legal assistance to navigate this process. This section is subjected to revisions and updates according to any changes in the Indian Partnership Act 1932 and other related laws or amendments.
content.Losses:
Without prejudice to any other provision in this agreement, it is hereby expressly understood and agreed upon between the parties that, in respect to the capital and monetary contribution by the parties mentioned herein, all losses including but not limited to damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, either direct or indirect, consequential or incidental, suffered or incurred by the partnership (whether in connection with the operation of its business or otherwise) shall be borne and paid first out of the partnership profits, next out of the partners' capital, and lastly, if necessary, by the partners equally.

Furthermore, in the event the partnership business incurs a loss during any financial year, such loss shall be shared by the parties equally. Notwithstanding anything contained herein, the parties are obliged to compensate the partnership for any loss that may be sustained due to fraud or gross negligence by either of the parties in their capacity as partners of the partnership.

Any dispute or difference arising in connection with this, or the validity, interpretation, breach or alleged breach of this agreement, shall be adjudicated as per the judiciary laws of India.

This partnership agreement, composed of an amount of 1004217.082 INR for a duration of 24 months, is governed and construed in accordance with the laws of India. It is obligatory upon all parties involved to completely understand and adhere to the stipulated clauses throughout the contract term and any wilful breach shall be viewed with punitive measures consistent with the Indian legal framework.
content.Partnership Authority:
Any act carried out by one partner relating to the typical business operations of the partnership firm binds the firm and all other partners, as outlined in the Indian Partnership Act, 1932. Unless a partner has no authority to act for the firm in certain matters, and the person dealing with the partner either knows he has no such authority or does not know him to be a partner, his act in usual business operations binds the entity and all associated individuals.

Should a partner commit or make a significant error in furtherance of the usual business of the firm, or administer an act he reasonably anticipates may prevent the occurring of loss to the firm, that mistake or act would bind the entity and all related parties. However, this is applicable only so long as the partner acts in the typical business operation execution of the firm, for example, the partner may contract a debt on behalf of the firm, but he may not gratuitously gift the properties of the firm.

For the Partnership between the parties relating to OLA, no partner shall, without the written consent from the other parties, have the powers or authority to bind the other party or parties, commit the partnership to any agreements outside the normal scope of the partnership business, draw or accept any bill of exchange or promissory note in the name of the partnership.

Any decision regarding the partnership business requiring a commitment of more than 1004217.082 INR or outside the usual scope of the firm's business operation would need written approval from all the partners and cannot be carried out by any single partner, even within the 24 months duration specified within the agreement. It should be noted that any partner acting outside of these confines could be held liable for any potential loss or damages.

In conclusion, all business of the partnership should be carried out with the mutually agreed interest of all partners and within the limitations of authority set by the written consent of all partners.
content.Partnership Contributions:
The two partners, henceforth known as the "Parties", mutually agree that the total capital of the partnership, identified as the "Capital Account", will be the total sum of INR 1,004,217.082. This Capital Account will be contributed solely by the client, known hereinafter as 'OLA'. The full amount of INR 1,004,217.082 will be contributed by OLA as an upfront contribution at the commencement of this agreement to form the complete partnership capital.

This capital shall be used exclusively for the purpose of the business which forms the subject matter of this Agreement. It is, however, clear that no interest will accrue or be payable on the contributed capital made by OLA.

If further capital is needed in the course of the partnership for its smooth operation or expansion, the additional sum shall be provided by OLA. However, such additional contribution will be made only after mutual agreement between the Parties concerned regarding the necessity and the amount of such additional contribution.

In event the parties determine that additional contributions are required, the method of valuing such contribution, and the conditions under which a partner may choose not to make such additional contribution shall be mutually agreed upon at the time such decision is made.

The contribution made by OLA to the Partnership shall remain in the Partnership until the partnership is wound up or the Partnership Agreement is terminated, which is set to last for a duration of 24 months from the date this Agreement is executed.

Any disputes between the Parties in respect of this clause or any other provisions of this Agreement shall be resolved in accordance with the jurisdiction of the courts of India. The business language, for all intents and purposes, shall be British English.
content.Partnership Decision Making:
All decisions relating to the functioning and management of the partnership firm will be taken mutually by all partners. For the purposes of decision making, unless otherwise stated, all partners shall have an equal right to voice an opinion and vote on the decisions. All major decisions necessitating a change in the normal course of operations of the partnership firm, such as investment or divestment in new areas of business, borrowing above a stipulated limit, disposition of the assets of the firm and any decision which may have a substantial impact on the firm's operations and cash flow shall be taken only with the mutual consent of all partners. However, for the routine day-to-day affairs, an active partner can take the appropriate decision in the best interest of the partnership firm.

In case of any conflict or disagreement on any decision, the same shall be resolved amicably through dialogue and discussion amongst all partners. If, however, a resolution does not emerge from such discussion, the matter may be referred for arbitration to a mutually agreed arbitrator. The arbitrator's decision shall be binding on all partners.

Notwithstanding the above, if any decision contravenes any existing laws and regulations of India, or is found to be in contravention after the decision has been taken, the decision shall be deemed invalid and the partners shall not be bound by their obligations under such decision.

During the terms of the agreement, the partners shall each contribute an amount of 1004217.082 INR to the partnership firm. This contribution shall be used for the running of the firm, and shall not be considered as a loan unless otherwise specifically agreed in writing by all the partners. This partnership agreement is valid for a duration of 24 months from the date of the agreement.

This agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of India and any dispute arising out of this agreement shall be within the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of India.
content.Partnership Formation:
By this agreement, entered into this day, it is mutually agreed and understood between the parties involved. Representing the first party is OLA, hereinafter referred to as the 'First Party', agreeable to invest a capital of INR 1004217.082 into a common partnership business. The second party, who shall be participating in this partnership agreement, hereinafter referred to as the 'Second Party', will also contribute capital as mutually agreed.

This partnership will be effective for a period of 24 months commencing from the date of execution of this Agreement, or until it may be terminated under the clause provided herein for the dissolution of the Partnership.

The capital to be invested by the First Party shall be paid over in such a way and such a time as may be agreed upon by mutual consent. The second party will also contribute capital as agreed in a most timely fashion.

Each party will have equal rights to manage and control the partnership and its business. Consequently, all decisions will be made by mutual agreement. However, no partner shall transfer or assign their partnership interest to any other person without the consent of the remaining partner.

During the term of our partnership, all profits and losses of the partnership business shall be divided equally between the partners, unless otherwise mutually agreed.

The partnership may be dissolved at any time by agreement of the partners, in which event the partners shall proceed with reasonable promptness to liquidate the business of the partnership. The partnership name shall be sold with the other assets of the business. The assets of the partnership business shall be used and distributed in the following order:

(a) to pay or provide for the payment of all partnership liabilities and liquidating expenses and obligations;
(b) to equalise the income accounts of the partners;
(c) to discharge the balance of the income accounts of the partners;
(d) to equalise the capital accounts of the partners; and
(e) to discharge the balance of the capital accounts of the partners.

This partnership agreement has been executed as per the relevant laws and regulations of the jurisdiction of India. Any disputes arising from this partnership agreement shall be resolved by arbitration as per the prevailing laws of India.
content.and Draws:
In accordance with the laws, statutes and provisions in force in the Republic of India, each party hereto, the Partners, on an individual and independent basis, may draw and withdraw the amount of One Million Four Thousand Two Hundred Seventeen and Eighty-Two Paise only (INR 1,004,217.082) per annum from the net profits of the Partnership. The draws will be accounted for and distributed equally between the parties as salary or alternatively as a lowering of their capital accounts.

Such authorised draw or withdrawal by the parties shall be carried out subject to the conditions that the Partnership has sufficient profits, and it does not in any way risk or jeopardise the Partnership's financial robustness, solvency, or the ability of the Partnership to cover all of its debts, dues, liabilities and obligations.

The Parties agree that in the event that a Partner draws or withdraws more than their relevant proportionate part or share of the accumulated partnership profits in a particular year, such excess amount will be treated as a loan by the partnership to that partner until returned.

The draws or withdrawals shall not, under any circumstances, be considered as an advance against future earnings or a distribution of capital or profits that the Partnership may make in the future, but instead, a return on capital contributed in the Partnership. Any such draw is to be recorded by the Partners and properly accounted for in the Partnership's books.

The right to draw or withdraw profits in the manner described herein is available to both Partners for the full term of this Agreement, being 24 months. Such rights shall be executed by the Partners in good faith and in a manner that invariably respects and upholds the mutual trust, respect and cooperative spirit evident by the existence of the Partnership and being foundational principles of this Agreement.

The Parties thus agree that any disputes, controversies or claims in connection with or stemming from such draws or withdrawals or this clause, if not amicably resolved among the Parties, shall be resolved in the manner described in the Dispute Resolution segment of this Agreement.

example.query: Generate me a disclaimer for Use of Information

data.answer: The information provided here is for general informational purposes only. We make no warranties about its accuracy or suitability for any purpose. Users are responsible for their actions and decisions based on this information. We are not liable for any damages, and all content is protected by copyright. We may update these terms at any time.

result.email_body:
{name},

This is a friendly reminder regarding the document that requires your review and electronic signature.

As previously communicated, an important document awaits your attention. You can access the document and initiate the signing process by clicking on the secure link provided here: {contract_link}

Your review and signature on this document are crucial to our ongoing [project/collaboration/transaction]. We kindly request that you complete this process at your earliest convenience to ensure that there are no delays in our progress.

Your prompt action on this matter is greatly appreciated, and we thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,

{name},

I am pleased to inform you that we have received your electronic signature on the document we recently sent for review and approval.

Your prompt attention to this matter is greatly appreciated, and I'm delighted to confirm that the document status is now complete. This signifies that all necessary signatures have been obtained, and the document is fully executed.

Thank you once again for your cooperation and timely response. We look forward to continuing our successful collaboration.

Best regards,

{name},

We would like to inform you that the e-contract has been cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances.

Any previous agreements related to this e-contract are now null and void. We will handle the necessary administrative tasks to ensure a smooth cancellation process.

We appreciate your understanding and cooperation during this process. If you have any further instructions or specific requirements related to this cancellation, please let us know, and we will work with you to ensure your needs are met.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,

{signee_name},

I am writing to inform you that I have sent a document your way that requires your attention and electronic signature.

To access the document and initiate the signing process, please click on the following link: {contract_link}

Your prompt review and signature are greatly appreciated. If you have any questions or need further clarification regarding the content or the signing process, please do not hesitate to reach out to me at {contact_information}.

Once you have completed the e-signature process, you will receive a confirmation email. This will help ensure a smooth and efficient workflow.

Thank you for your cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving the signed document at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
